content.question: Let <math alttext="f " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, 5 times the cosine squared of, open parenthesis, x over 2, close parenthesis, plus the natural log of, open parenthesis, x plus 1, close parenthesis, minus 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The derivative of <math alttext="f " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, negative 5 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, x over 2, close parenthesis, times the sine of, open parenthesis, x over 2, close parenthesis, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator x plus 1, end fraction " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. What value of <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> satisfies the conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem applied to <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 4, close bracket " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: 2.132 because <math alttext="f of 2.132, equals, the fraction with numerator f of 4, minus f of 1, and denominator 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2.132</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

2.749 because <math alttext="f prime of 2.749, equals, the fraction with numerator f of 4, minus f of 1, and denominator 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2.749</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

3.042 because <math alttext="f prime of 3.042, equals, 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3.042</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

3.252 because <math alttext="f prime of 3.252, equals, the fraction with numerator f of 1, plus f of 4, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3.252</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: 2.749 because <math alttext="f prime of 2.749, equals, the fraction with numerator f of 4, minus f of 1, and denominator 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2.749</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
